title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle hold and kiss Archie in ITV documentary
text:
The Duke of Sussex is seen cradling baby Archie as wife Meghan Markle gently kisses their son's head, in a behind-the-scenes moment revealed in a new trailer for an ITV documentary about the royal tour.

Harry and Meghan: An African Journey will air on Sunday at 9pm, with presenter Tom Brady promising it will reveal both the 'pride and happiness' and 'pain and pressure' of royal life.

The new trailer for the documentary released today revealed Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan, 38, sharing an intimate family moment with their four-month-old son just moments before meeting Archbishop Desmond Tutu.

In the short clip, Prince Harry can be seen cuddling and 'bouncing' Archie in his arms, while Meghan kisses and strokes their son's head.

Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 38, can be seen snuggling up with baby Archie in an intimate family moment caught on camera for an upcoming ITV documentary 'Harry and Meghan: An African Journey'

The couple are seen ahead of meeting Archbishop Desmond Tutu, with Harry holding his son while his wife tenderly kisses Archie's head

It was the first time fans were able to get a clear look at a rapidly growing Archie, who had only previously been glimpsed at a photo call at Windsor Castle when he was a few days old

The 'An African Journey' trailer revealed behind-the-scenes moments from the couple's royal tour of Africa.

Just moments before taking their four-month-old baby to meet Archbishop Desmond Tutu in his first appearance on the royal tour, the trio enjoyed the touching moment.

While holding on to Archie, Harry also clutched a light blue blanket wrapped around his son before gently placing a hand around his head in a protective move.

Meghan, wearing a printed dress by Club Monaco and her hair in a chic knotted bun, leans in to her husband and son who stole the show in blue striped dungarees and matching booties.

The moment is brief, as Prince Harry is quick to mouth, 'let's go', before thanking the ITV cameras and moving off-screen.

The clip appeared to capture a quiet moment for the couple, who had a packed and busy schedule throughout their 10 day tour.

Prince Harry can be seen cradling Archie in his arms, and clutching a light blue blanket, while he gently bounced his son up-and-down in a soothing fashion. Meghan gently kissed the baby, before stroking a tuft of hair on his head

Proud parents Meghan and Harry brought their son along with them on their ten-day Africa tour which will likely cover the triumphs of their trip

Fans were treated to a glimpse of Archie when Meghan and Harry took along their son to meet the Archbishop and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe in Cape Town

The couple shared several tender moments during their trip which was all captured on camera for the documentary

When Meghan and Prince Harry took their son along to meet Archbishop Desmond Tutu and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe in Cape Town, fans were treated to a glimpse of Archie that they'd long hoped for.

Previously fans have only caught brief sightings of the newest royal baby, including a photo call at Windsor Castle when he was a few days old, his face barely visible behind a blanket.

During his meeting with the man they call 'The Arch', Archie posed with his proud mother and father.

The Archbishop pretended to bite Archie's hand int he adorable photos released from the royal visit

The Duchess of Sussex and her husband laughed as Archie stole the show as he grinned at the camera and the Archbishop

Archie looked adorable for his surprise public appearance as he stole the limelight from his parents

Meghan holds little Archie - who giggles at his mother - as they are greeted by Archbishop Tutu and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe

The Sussexes later released adorable footage of them carrying their four-month-old, with the caption, 'Arch meets Archie!'.

Video posted to their Instagram account showed the couple beaming as Meghan holds little Archie - who giggles at his mother - as they are greeted by Archbishop Tutu and his daughter, Thandeka Tutu-Gxashe.

Baby Archie's debut on his first royal official tour also left fans staggered by just how much he looks like Prince Harry did as a baby.

The ITV documentary goes behind the scenes of the royal couple's recent tour of Africa where they had a packed and busy schedule throughout their 10 day trip

The ITV documentary, which airs next Sunday, is sure to cover the triumphs of the tour, as well as the response to the news the couple were planning to take legal action against the tabloid press

His first photographed public outing was a trip to watch Prince Harry play polo in July 2019, and fans were also treated to a few photos from his christening that same month.

The ITV documentary, which airs next Sunday, is sure to cover the triumphs of the tour, as well as the response to the news the couple were planning to take legal action against the tabloid press.

While on the tour, the royal couple announced Meghan had decided to take legal action against the Mail on Sunday after publication of a letter to her estranged father Thomas Markle.

And in the trailer, Tom Brady's voiceover alludes to Prince Harry's attack, revealing how the trip ended up being an 'unexpected' journey.

He said: 'The story of their time in Africa was of a passion for their work, pride and happiness but also a world of pressure and pain behind the brave faces.'

Harry and Meghan: An African Journey will air on Sunday October 20 at 9pm
description: In the first trailer for Harry and Meghan: An African Journey, which is set to air on ITV next Sunday, Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 38, can be seen snatching an intimate family moment.
